title: **Monodispersed as prepared a-Si:H colloids with low refractive index.**
body:
\(The model synthesis described below targets at the a-Si particles with 25% hydrogen content and average diameter of 430 nm.)


_Step 1: Synthesis preparation_

body.title: a)
body.body: Set the Variac to 70% power and preheat the brass block 60 °C above the desired reaction temperature \(i. e., 485 °C in this case), with an empty reactor inside the brass heating block to maintain good thermocouple contact.

body.title: b)
body.body: Clean the titanium reactor and the plug with chloroform and dry in the fumehood.

body.title: c)
body.body: Put the reactor and the plug into the ante-chamber of the glovebox. Take 3 cycles of exhaustion and at least 10 minutes for each cycle.

body.title: d)
body.body:
Prepare an ice bath in a bucket. The water level should be lower than the height of the reactor.


_Step 2: Loading reagents_

body.title: a)
body.body: Move the reactor and the plug to the glovebox.

body.title: b)
body.body:
Measure 5.8 mL of n-Hexane and 18 μL of trisilane and add to the reactor. Put on the plug and tighten with a wrench.


\(This operation should be done immediately to avoid any evaporation of trisilane.)

body.title: c)
body.body:
Remove the reactor from the glovebox and further tighten the plug with the vice and the wrench.


_Step 3: Synthesis._

body.title: a)
body.body: Remove the empty reactor from the preheated brass block and place in the loaded reaction vessel.

body.title: b)
body.body:
Change the temperature setting to the desired reaction temperature \(425 °C), and start the timer.


\(The temperature detected by the thermocouple will drop the desired reaction temperature and return within 3 min. Long stabilization time \(> 3 min) usually leads to lower hydrogen content of particles.)

body.title: c)
body.body:
After 10 min, remove the reactor from the heating block with tongs and submerge in the ice bath to quench to room temperature.


_Step 4: Purification._

body.title: a)
body.body: After the reaction vessel cools to room temperature, open the reactor with a wrench and collect the product with a glass pipette.

body.title: b)
body.body: Centrifuge the product at 8000 rpm for 5 min to precipitate the particles.

body.title: c)
body.body: Discard the supernatant, redisperse the product in 5 mL of chloroform with sonication, and centrifuge again.

body.title: d)
body.body: Discard the supernatant, redisperse the particles in chloroform. The dispersion is typically stored under ambient conditions.

title: **High vacuum annealing to obtain monodisperse high refractive index silicon colloids**

body.title: a)
body.body: Evaporate the solvent from the a-Si:H colloidal suspension by heating it in an oven at 120 °C.

body.title: b)
body.body: Put the dried a-Si:H particles into a chamber.

body.title: c)
body.body: Make high vacuum within the chamber using turbo-molecular vacuum pump.

body.title: d)
body.body: Annealing the chamber with oven to a certain temperature for one hour \(200 °C - 600 °C in our experiments).

body.title: e)
body.body: Let the chamber cool down slowly \(around 1 °C /min) to room temperature under vacuum environment.

body.title: f)
body.body: Rediperse silicon colloids in chloroform.

body.title: a)
body.body: Set up the home-made confocal microscope combined with a spectrometer coupler working in NIR region. A graph of the setup is shown in Figure 2.

body.title: b)
body.body: Place a drop of silicon colloid suspension drop on a glass substrate and wait for the chloroform to evaporate.

body.title: c)
body.body: Put the glass substrate onto the sample holder of the confocal microscope and focus the sample.

body.title: d)
body.body: Select a single particle and close the confocal aperture of the setup. Only the sample whose image falls inside the aperture area can be measured.

body.title: e)
body.body: Tune the designed spectrometer coupler of the setup, and optimize the signal-noise ratio of the setup. The designed spectrometer coupler is shown inside the Figure 2.

body.title: f)
body.body: Measure the spectra once the InGaAs detector is cooled down with liquid nitrogen.
